snippet: The sudden end of crippling energy shortages and the re-emergence of the police suggest that those opposed to President Mohamed Morsi had tried to undermine his administration.
abstract: Sudden end of Egypt's crippling energy shortages and re-emergence of police on the streets suggest that those opposed to ousted Pres Mohamed Morsi had tried to undermine his Islamist administration by disrupting overall quality of life.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

lead_paragraph: The sudden end of crippling energy shortages and the re-emergence of the police suggest that those opposed to President Mohamed Morsi had tried to undermine his administration.

headline.main: Sudden Improvements in Egypt Suggest a Campaign to Undermine Morsi
headline.print_headline: Sudden Improvements in Egypt Suggest a Campaign to Undermine Morsi

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
